repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Use a singular function that can specify properties on the namespace.

Removed `nvim__win_xx_ns` functions as they are no longer needed.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
/// Returns true if the namespace is scoped in the given window.
static inline bool ns_in_win(uint32_t ns_id, win_T *wp)
```

this should accept `opts.win` (or maybe `opts.wins: number[]` if we really care about avoiding multiple calls) to set the scope.

That allows us to remove the `nvim__win_xx_ns` functions, right?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1291,3 +1281,47 @@ Boolean nvim__win_del_ns(Window window, Integer ns_id, Error *err)
 
   return true;
 }
+
+/// EXPERIMENTAL: this API will change in the future.
+///
+/// Set some properties for namespace
+///
+/// @param ns_id Namespace
+/// @param opts Optional parameters to set:
+///           - scoped: (boolean) Make the namespace a scoped namespace
+///
+void nvim__ns_set(Integer ns_id, Dict(ns_opts) *opts, Error *err)

comment_data.body: I'm still [wondering](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27361#discussion_r1597710114) why the `opts.scoped` parameter is needed. If a namespace was assigned to windows/buffers/etc, it's scoped. Else it's not scoped.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1291,3 +1281,47 @@ Boolean nvim__win_del_ns(Window window, Integer ns_id, Error *err)
 
   return true;
 }
+
+/// EXPERIMENTAL: this API will change in the future.
+///
+/// Set some properties for namespace
+///
+/// @param ns_id Namespace
+/// @param opts Optional parameters to set:
+///           - scoped: (boolean) Make the namespace a scoped namespace

@@ -1291,3 +1281,47 @@ Boolean nvim__win_del_ns(Window window, Integer ns_id, Error *err)

comment_data.body: Then I'll just remote the option
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1291,3 +1281,47 @@ Boolean nvim__win_del_ns(Window window, Integer ns_id, Error *err)
 
   return true;
 }
+
+/// EXPERIMENTAL: this API will change in the future.
+///
+/// Set some properties for namespace
+///
+/// @param ns_id Namespace
+/// @param opts Optional parameters to set:
+///           - scoped: (boolean) Make the namespace a scoped namespace

comment_data.body:
Internally, storing the namespaces on the window (`w_ns_set `) might still be the right approach. Does that make cleanup easier (when a window is destroyed)? Otherwise `namespace_scope_map[..]->windows` will have stale ids in it? It also seems a bit more natural.

So the interface is `nvim__ns_set(..., {wins:...})`, but internally the namespaces are stored on the window/buffer/tabpage objects. This is perhaps a compromise (vs the [ideal(?) interface](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28728#issuecomment-2117553866)), but it's presumably desirable to have a `nvim__ns_get()` which gets all namespace properties, instead of forcing users to iterate all the buffers/windows/tabs.

comment_regular_data.body: It may be better to be able to change a namespace from global scope to window scope in one API call. The API will be like `nvim_ns_set_scope` or `nvim_set_ns_scope` or some other variation.

> The API will be like `nvim_ns_set_scope`

Can we have a generic `nvim_ns_set()` function which sets various properties of the namespace?

This looks like the right direction to me. 

Would it be more ideal to [set namespaces as global-local options](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/25455#discussion_r1345851839)? That might still be blocked by high-risk work. @bfredl

labels.description: marks, extmarks, decorations, virtual text, namespaces
labels.name: marks

title: feat: set properties on namespaces
